title: GLP-800 and Muramana
body:
I've asked on a couple of facebooks pages but nobody has been able to give me an answer yet. I'm looking at the new hextech items for teemo (yes go on, hate on me) and I'm wondering if the GLP-800 would go well with Muramana. I'm not very good at figuring out this stuff from trying in game, but to me it makes sense that the passive on GLP-800 that restores health on mana usage would apply to Muramana's passive of consuming 3% of mana for single target spells and AA's.

Thanks!

replies.body: Health gain is capped per spell or per second on toggles
Muramana isn't a toggle any more though. So you're saying that it would?
spells as in q w e or r, the heal wont do too much for teemo

Thanks for the reply. No his spells won't give a whole lot of healing but if you build attack speed as well the healing from the aa's would be alright. That is assuming that these two items work the way I'm thinking they might.

does yi e work with it? no

Does ww passive work with it? no

Does wits end work with it? no

does onhit effects work with it? no

Therefore his e doesn't work

"spells with mana expendature"

Lets look at the strengths of the items

Muramana deals an attack bonus equal to 2% of your maximum mana and also consumes 3% of your current to deal bonus attack damage against champions while granting you 1000 mana and 25 attack and refunding 15% of all mana used. 

Hextech GLP grants 300 health 400 mana 80 AP with a passive that restores 15% of damage taken as mana while also restoring 25% of the mana cost with health while also having an active that fires icy bolts that slow enemies while dealing 200(+35% AP) in damage. 

Now we have to take in consideration the type of champions you'd build these items on. Well you would build Muramana on champions like Ezreal, Jayce and Urgot who are primarily considered AD champions.

Also you have to consider that the item GLP-800 doesn't really offer AD but instead gives you AP that you really don't need. The fact that you won't need the AP makes the items benefits become weighed down by the sheer costs. The passive offers decent sustain but I think if you were to Opt for this path you would be much better off going seraph's embrace. If you're playing an AD champion you'd be much better off picking a frozen fist or maybe even a frozen heart or just simply more AD items.

I think the restoration passive isn't quite that useful since muramana's passive that consumes mana only procs against champions while also already having a passive that mitigates mana cost.

Thanks for they reply. I was thinking of using this itemization for teemo as he is an ap aa champ rather than any ad champ. I like getting the GLP-800 now anyway for all the stats plus the icy bolts are awesome. It was the passive health restore that got me thinking about muramana and if it would be a good combination on a teemo. I can really think of any ap aa champs off the top of my head.
